DataElement.preferredName: Lymphoma Central Nervous System Other Cancer Progression Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes involving the part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges yet occurring at a site different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lymphoma Central Nervous System Other Cancer Progression
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes involving the part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges yet occurring at a site different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites.  This category includes Non-Hodgkin's lymphomas and Hodgkin's lymphomas. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.

Property.preferredName: Central Nervous System Other Cancer Progression
Property.preferredDefinition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges. :Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.

Concepts.definition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify an anatomic site.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
